CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( ORG seadustik ) stipulates that the participation of counsel in court proceedings is mandatory .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , an appeal in cassation may be filed by an advocate acting as criminal defence counsel .

Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that an appeal in cassation must be lodged within DATE of the date when a party to the proceedings had the opportunity to examine the judgment of the court of appeal . Paragraph CARDINAL provides that , at the request of the appellant , ORG may restore the time - limit for an appeal in cassation if it was allowed to expire for good reason .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL sets forth the requirements for an appeal in cassation . These requirements include formal ones , such as the personal details of the appellant and details of the judgment appealed against , as well as substantial ones , such as an indication of the appellant ’s request and reasoning setting out why he or she considers that the substantive law was incorrectly applied or the criminal procedural law was violated . Pursuant to LAW , if an appeal in cassation does not meet the requirements set out in LAW , ORG gives the appellant a time - limit for amending the appeal ; in case of a failure to amend the appeal , or if the appeal has been submitted too late , ORG rejects the appeal .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that the incorrect application of substantive law and the material violation of criminal procedural law are grounds for appeal in cassation . The latter ground is defined in LAW , which at the material time read as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) A violation of criminal procedural law is material if :
CARDINAL ) a decision is made in a criminal matter by an unlawful court panel ;
CARDINAL ) a criminal matter is heard in the absence of the accused , except in the cases provided for in Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of this Code ;
CARDINAL ) NORP court proceedings are conducted without the participation of counsel ;
CARDINAL ) NORP court proceedings are conducted without the participation of the prosecutor ;
CARDINAL ) the confidentiality of deliberations is breached in the making of a judgment ;
CARDINAL ) a judgment is not signed by all members of the court panel ;
CARDINAL ) a judgment does not contain reasons ;
CARDINAL) the conclusions presented in the conclusion of a judgment do not correspond to the facts established with regard to the subject of proof ;
CARDINAL ) a criminal matter is heard in a language in which the accused is not proficient without the participation of a translator or interpreter ;
CARDINAL ) a record is not made of a court session , with the exception of matters heard by way of summary proceedings .
( CARDINAL ) A court may declare any other violation of criminal procedural law to be material if such violation results or may result in an unlawful or unfounded judgment . ”
